html: ear. Old English = to plough: from Anglo-Saxon erian: and this from the Latin arare : the Aryan root AR entering into many words with a cognate reference. ARt (ploughing being the oldest art); oAR (with which the water is ploughed); ARtos(Greek for bread); eARth; ARatrum (Latin, a plough); ARare (to plough). The verb"ear" is found only here,Deuteronomy 21:4 , and1 Samuel 8:12 . The noun "earing" occurs inGenesis 45:6 , andExodus 34:21 .
